description: Extension at second floor level to provide 5 x additional self-contained residential units (2 x 1 bed and 3 x 2 bed) with associated car parking, cycle storage and refuse storage provision.
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s) Site Location Plan ref. 110; Site Plan ref. 111; Existing Elevations ref. 105E rev. E; Proposed Site Plan ref. 109D rev D; Existing Floor Plans ref. 113A rev A; Proposed Roof Extension First Floor Plan ref. 150B rev B; Proposed Roof Extension Second Floor Plan ref. 151B rev B; Proposed Roof Extension Elevations ref. 152B rev B; Proposed Roof Extension Roof Plan ref. 153.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, in the interest of proper planning.
| Notwithstanding the details shown on the approved plans, all external materials to be used in the development shall match the materials of the existing building on this site.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies 1.1 (g), 1.2 (f), 3.1 (b) of the Adopted Core Strategy (2012) and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016).
| The refuse and recycling storage facilities hereby approved shall be implemented and operational before the first occupation of any part of the development, and permanently retained thereafter.

Reason:  In the interests of the adequate disposal, storage and collection of waste and recycling, in accordance with policies with policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), and policy 5.16 of the London Plan (2016).

| Prior to the first occupation of the development, details of cycle parking for a minimum of eight cycle spaces hereby approved shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The cycle parking facilities shall be permanently retained thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The cycle parking shall be provided and located in a secure undercover and lockable compound.

Reason: In the interests of highway and pedestrian safety in accordance with policies 1.1 f of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 6.9 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| The vehicle parking arrangements shown on the approved plans shall be marked out on the site prior to first occupation of the development, and these spaces shall be kept continuously available and shall not be used for any other purpose. No additional car parking shall be formed or made available except with the prior permission of the local planning authority obtained through the submission of a planning application.

Reason: To ensure that there is adequate parking provision within the site, in accordance with policies 1.1 (f) (g) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2026 (2012); policies 6.3, 6.11 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2016); and section 4 of the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| Building envelope insulation for the approved additional residential units, with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided, shall be installed to achieve the internal noise targets adopted by the Local Planning Authority:
a.	Bedrooms (23.00-07.00 hrs) 30 dB LAeq and 45 dB Lmax (fast).
b.	Living rooms (07.00-23.00 hrs) 35 dB LAeq.
c.	Kitchens, bathrooms, WC and utility rooms (07.00-23.00 hrs) 45 dB LAeq.
The sound insulation measures shall be installed and fully completed prior to the first occupation of the flats and maintained thereafter.

Reason: To protect residential amenity, in accordance with policies 7.15 of the London Plan (2016); policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012); policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and interim SPG10: Noise and Vibration.

| 8	A detailed method statement relating to the development hereby approved shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the use on-site.  The statement shall include the following details:
a.	Removal of any earth from the site.
b.	Demolition and construction methods.
c.	Site management and access.
d.	Signage for construction traffic, pedestrians and other users of the site.
e.	Prevention of mud and debris being deposited on Fraser Road, Aintree Road and Western Avenue (A40).
f.	Vehicle and machinery specification.
g.	Turning manoeuvres and routeing of vehicles.
h.	Estimated number and frequency of vehicle deliveries.
i.	Parking of construction vehicles.
j.	Compliance with noise limits and vibration mitigation measures.
k.	Procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents.
l.	Mitigation of air pollution and dust emissions during site clearance, demolition, excavation and construction works.
m.	Waste management, hazardous material storage and removal.

Reason:  In the interest of the amenity of adjoining occupiers and to minimise highway and traffic impacts during the course of the works, in accordance with policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (adopted 2013).
